title: WHIRLING / KIM MAIN
description: These are the rest of Kims MAIN dialogues with you after he's in the squad.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What happened to you?" the lieuten..."
dialogueTree.text: "What happened to you?" the lieutenant asks as he leans in, eyes mapping your frozen face.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you could only find your gun.""
links.text: "If you could only find your gun."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Was there anything else you wanted..."
links.text: "Was there anything else you wanted to ask about the competition? If not, we should move."

links.title: You: "Close your eyes."
links.text: Close your eyes.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The rows are endless."
links.text: The rows are endless.

links.title: You: "Look for: Precinct 57 -> Lieutenant..."
links.text: Look for: Precinct 57 -> Lieutenants -> Kitsuragi, Kim.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The name "Kim 'Pinball' Kitsuragi"..."
links.text: The name "Kim 'Pinball' Kitsuragi" appears before you.

links.title: You: "Cases solved?"
links.text: Cases solved?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "One hundred and four."
links.text: One hundred and four.

links.title: You: "Confirmed kills?"
links.text: Confirmed kills?

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Six."
links.text: Six.

links.title: You: "Blink."
links.text: Blink.

links.title: You: "Look for: Precinct 41."
links.text: Look for: Precinct 41.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Jean Vicquemare, Judit Minot... A s..."
links.text: Jean Vicquemare, Judit Minot... A special consultant... what was his name? Then the rows degrade into green nothingness.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Your brothers have left you."
links.text: Your brothers have left you.

links.title: You: "Open your eyes."
links.text: Open your eyes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant is thinking to himse..."
links.text: The lieutenant is thinking to himself. His eyebrows are slightly raised.

links.title: You: ""So you volunteered to spoil it.""
links.text: "So you volunteered to spoil it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes. I'm an unrepentant spoilsport..."
links.text: "Yes. I'm an unrepentant spoilsport." The lieutenant appears pleased with this.

links.title: You: ""For some reason I thought you had..."
links.text: "For some reason I thought you had a hundred and *four* solved cases."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, *technically*," the lieutena..."
links.text: "Well, *technically*," the lieutenant says, somewhat sheepishly. "The official record keeper has been known to double-count murder-suicides."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "A common accounting gimmick used to..."
links.text: A common accounting gimmick used to inflate precinct stats.

links.title: You: ""So, you're still a *good* cop, rig..."
links.text: "So, you're still a *good* cop, right?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm good enough for this case. I'm..."
links.text: "I'm good enough for this case. I'm not here to compete. I came because I had to. My fellow officers -- the sergeants, in particular -- would have made this scene into a circus."

links.title: You: ""Let's be honest: 102 is pathetic...."
links.text: "Let's be honest: 102 is pathetic. A very small number."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I wouldn't say that. And my case l..."
links.text: "I wouldn't say that. And my case load is measly, but that's beside the point..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He is not the least bit offended. H..."
links.text: He is not the least bit offended. He just wants you to know his case load should be much higher.

links.title: You: ""What's special about Martinaise?""
links.text: "What's special about Martinaise?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Martinaise? Nothing. It's just a p..."
links.text: "Martinaise? Nothing. It's just a puddle at the end of some drainpipe. No one cares about this place, they care about sports. Most of our colleagues don't even know how to get here. North of the Interchange doesn't exist."

links.title: Shivers: "A tremble comes over you, another a..."
links.text: A tremble comes over you, another after-effect of ethanol poisoning perhaps? Feels like leaves do when they rustle in the breeze, somewhere far away, below the Turbine. The 41st and the 57th... The lieutenant was right. It's not about who gets what's North, it's about who doesn't.

links.title: You: ""I wonder what this says about me?..."
links.text: "I wonder what this says about me? That I was sent by my station?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm..." He raises an eyebrow, thin..."
links.text: "Hmm..." He raises an eyebrow, thinking it best to let you make the next move.

links.title: Logic: "Clearly, he has already formed his..."
links.text: Clearly, he has already formed his own theory.

links.title: Inland Empire: "Tell him. Tell him why it's you."
links.text: Tell him. Tell him why it's you.

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's all part of the Masterplan, yo..."
links.text: It's all part of the Masterplan, you see.

links.title: You: ""Okay, enough of the competition th..."
links.text: "Okay, enough of the competition then. Tell me something else." (Conclude.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, it's a wholly pointless matte..."
links.text: "Yes, it's a wholly pointless matter. Forget I ever mentioned it."

links.title: Suggestion: "He's actually glad it's addressed n..."
links.text: He's actually glad it's addressed now.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay... About that call.""
dialogueTree.text: "Okay... About that call."

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Detective, about what the twins ha..."
dialogueTree.text: "Detective, about what the twins had to say..."

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's dark," the lieutenant states..."
dialogueTree.text: "It's dark," the lieutenant states the obvious.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you're trying to get in touch w..."
links.text: "If you're trying to get in touch with the Coalition, I would start by finding some way to apologise to him. But first you might need to speak with his *young companion*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, was there anything else?""
links.text: "Now, was there anything else?"

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think we may have this..." The l..."
dialogueTree.text: "I think we may have this..." The lieutenant whispers, then gives the suspect a short glance.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then why did they send you?""
links.text: "Then why did they send you?"

links.title: You: ""I am a highly experimental cop. Bu..."
links.text: "I am a highly experimental cop. But if I am right... this is *outré* even by my standards."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Really?" His eyebrow gets raised o..."
links.text: "Really?" His eyebrow gets raised one more notch.

links.title: You: ""I arrive at the scene three days e..."
links.text: "I arrive at the scene three days early, drink myself to oblivion, fully re-immerse myself in this reality and then work the case from an angle so crescent fresh it produces *never before seen* results. Not only for criminology, but for the human mind."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It can't be that..." Part of him s..."
links.text: "It can't be that..." Part of him sort of wants to believe what you just said.

links.title: You: ""It isn't. But I will prove it so.""
links.text: "It isn't. But I will prove it so."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I hope you do.""
links.text: "I hope you do."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "And he will help."
links.text: And he will help.

links.title: You: ""I am a notoriously difficult-to-wo..."
links.text: "I am a notoriously difficult-to-work-with *wunderkind* with extremely  unorthodox methods."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wouldn't that be something? And wh..."
links.text: "Wouldn't that be something? And who could say it's not true? If you really don't remember anything... how would you know?" The thought makes him uneasy. "We should move."

links.title: You: ""Of course not. I'm just a drunk. T..."
links.text: "Of course not. I'm just a drunk. They sent a drunk."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you sure? Who could say it's n..."
links.text: "Are you sure? Who could say it's not true? If you really don't remember anything.... how would you know?" The thought makes him uneasy. "We should move."

links.title: You: ""Forget it, it's too much.""
links.text: "Forget it, it's too much."

links.title: You: ""I was sent to teach you a lesson i..."
links.text: "I was sent to teach you a lesson in *style*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay." He takes a step back. "Styl..."
links.text: "Okay." He takes a step back. "Style me."

links.title: Rhetoric: "It's impossible to tell whether he'..."
links.text: It's impossible to tell whether he's serious or joking.

links.title: Composure: "This man has sharp, precise composu..."
links.text: This man has sharp, precise composure, without impatience. Years of being himself have whittled the tension down to readiness. He is at home in what must be a subtly thought out set of apparel. Do you even have anything to teach him?

links.title: You: ""Everything from scalp down is top..."
links.text: "Everything from scalp down is top notch, but you need a patrol cap."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I don't need a patrol cap.""
links.text: "I don't need a patrol cap."

links.title: You: ""I know it seems unintuitive. But t..."
links.text: "I know it seems unintuitive. But trust me."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He thinks for a second. "Okay, mayb..."
links.text: He thinks for a second. "Okay, maybe I do."
"An *orange* patrol cap -- you need it."
"Okay, maybe you don't need an orange patrol cap. Let me think of something else."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He's waiting."
links.text: He's waiting.
"Orange patrol cap. I can't think of anything else."

links.title: You: "(Point to yourself.) "This is what..."
links.text: (Point to yourself.) "This is what a *modern* cop looks like."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In the New, twenty years ago. It's..."
links.text: "In the New, twenty years ago. It's what a modern cop looked like then."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "He means The New, the third decade..."
links.text: He means The New, the third decade of the current century. The decade of disco, decadence, and the victory of democracy-powered free market economy over it's critics.

links.title: You: "(Loosen your shoulders.) "You shoul..."
links.text: (Loosen your shoulders.) "You should ease up a bit. You need more *looseness*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No I don't. I *used* to. Plain clo..."
links.text: "No I don't. I *used* to. Plain clothes did the trick. For both of us, it seems." He nods toward you. "Now..."

links.title: You: ""There can only be one conclusion:..."
links.text: "There can only be one conclusion: I am the finest, a case-solving machine sent to outperform you in every way imaginable."

links.title: You: ""I must be an augury, an apocalypti..."
links.text: "I must be an augury, an apocalyptic omen sent by my people. Can you guess my message?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No.""
links.text: "No."

links.title: You: ""There will be a blood-letting of u..."
links.text: "There will be a blood-letting of unimaginable proportions. Un-imaginable."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh no, it's very imaginable. We fa..."
links.text: "Oh no, it's very imaginable. We fail to place responsibility for the hanging, the harbour company see the situation is out of control so they bring in private military, maybe a gunship, the Union responds in strength. Automatic fire."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Local law enforcement solving one..."
links.text: "Local law enforcement solving one little homicide decides nothing. Not solving it... can have real and calculable effects. Things can always get worse. Matter of fact, augury, we should move."

links.title: You: ""Better not to relay it.""
links.text: "Better not to relay it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I agree. Too dark.""
links.text: "I agree. Too dark."

links.title: You: ""You know, actually no. I'm not an..."
links.text: "You know, actually no. I'm not an augury. I don't why I said that."

links.title: You: ""Don't be scared, but I think I mig..."
links.text: "Don't be scared, but I think I might have supra-natural abilities."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He opens one hand and looks at it...."
links.text: He opens one hand and looks at it. A moment passes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Which school do you subscribe to -..."
links.text: "Which school do you subscribe to -- Mambo..." He opens the other hand: "...or Jambo?"

links.title: You: ""Wait, which one is the one where y..."
links.text: "Wait, which one is the one where you hear your tie talk to you?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mental illness.""
links.text: "Mental illness."

links.title: You: ""Because I have that.""
links.text: "Because I have that."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So the 41st Precinct sent you, bec..."
links.text: "So the 41st Precinct sent you, because you are the most mentally ill out of all the officers at your station?"

links.title: You: ""I don't know, I don't remember any..."
links.text: "I don't know, I don't remember any of the other officers."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Of course." Sounds like you just a..."
links.text: "Of course." Sounds like you just answered his question.

links.title: You: ""No, it's not that bad. I'm sure we..."
links.text: "No, it's not that bad. I'm sure we have officers way more mentally ill than me."

links.title: You: ""I don't have that -- I have someth..."
links.text: "I don't have that -- I have something cooler. What was that? Mambo and Jambo?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes.""
links.text: "Yes."

links.title: You: ""Mambo -- I have a vivid interior...."
links.text: "Mambo -- I have a vivid interior. I *see* and *feel* things."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's always good to have a police..."
links.text: "It's always good to have a police officer who can see and feel."

links.title: You: ""Jambo -- I get these strange *shiv..."
links.text: "Jambo -- I get these strange *shivers* from being hung over. Just before, a chill whisked down my back."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hangovers do give officers super-p..."
links.text: "Hangovers do give officers super-powers. Many drink only to receive *the gift*."

links.title: Rhetoric: "There is no gift. It must be repeat..."
links.text: There is no gift. It must be repeated: there is no *Gift*. It is meant as obvious sarcasm. Do not ask what *The Gift* is.

links.title: You: ""What is *the gift*?""
links.text: "What is *the gift*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There is no gift. We should move.""
links.text: "There is no gift. We should move."

links.title: You: ""I think I have it.""
links.text: "I think I have it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It is good to have a para-detectiv..."
links.text: "It is good to have a para-detective in a labour dispute. I can see why they sent you -- should we go?"

links.title: You: ""It's nothing major. Just feels a b..."
links.text: "It's nothing major. Just feels a bit strange that's all."

links.title: You: ""I think I might have both Mambo *a..."
links.text: "I think I might have both Mambo *and* Jambo -- I imagine strange things and get cold chills too."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I didn't know that was even possib..."
links.text: "I didn't know that was even possible. It must be a great burden."

links.title: You: ""It is.""
links.text: "It is."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's good to have...." His mouth t..."
links.text: "It's good to have...." His mouth twitches as he comes up with the expression: "...an *ambidextrous para-detective* in a labour dispute. I can see why they sent you -- should we go?"

links.title: You: ""It's not a burden, it's a gift.""
links.text: "It's not a burden, it's a gift."

links.title: You: ""It's both a burden -- and a gift.""
links.text: "It's both a burden -- and a gift."

links.title: You: ""I probably have an *unbelievable*..."
links.text: "I probably have an *unbelievable* kill count."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I bet you do.""
links.text: "I bet you do."

links.title: You: ""Why, do you agree?""
links.text: "Why, do you agree?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The 41st is known to kill people...."
links.text: "The 41st is known to kill people. Often."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "He neither approves, nor disapprove..."
links.text: He neither approves, nor disapproves. Yet there is something more there, something you can't put your finger on.

links.title: You: ""You're right. I am a super-predato..."
links.text: "You're right. I am a super-predator. Off leash like this... it's about to get very violent."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a good thing you found that g..."
links.text: "It's a good thing you found that gun. I can see why they sent you now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I for one hope I don't have to use..."
links.text: "I for one hope I don't have to use my service weapon at all -- like a *normal* police officer."

links.title: You: ""I will only use lethal force with..."
links.text: "I will only use lethal force with the utmost care and precision."

links.title: You: ""I'm gonna leave why I was sent *un..."
links.text: "I'm gonna leave why I was sent *unspecified*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The silence carries."
links.text: The silence carries.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I've been meaning to have a little..."
dialogueTree.text: "I've been meaning to have a little chat with you about your sense of *style*."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You may not *remember* taking any l..."
links.text: You may not *remember* taking any little 'tests', but you're strong as a goddamn ox. Anyone can see that!

links.title: Logic: "The thing is, the RCM employs relat..."
links.text: The thing is, the RCM employs relatively few *oxen*. It's clear that what the lieutenant may lack in *musculature* he makes up for in other ways.

links.title: You: "(Flex your bicep.) "Check it: I was..."
links.text: (Flex your bicep.) "Check it: I was made to crack skulls and solve cases."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Just because *your* precinct has a..."
links.text: "Just because *your* precinct has a reputation for cracking skulls doesn't mean that's the *only* way to solve a case... Was there anything else?"

links.title: You: ""You're wearing glasses.""
links.text: "You're wearing glasses."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's correct.""
links.text: "That's correct."

links.title: Physical Instrument: "That makes him a *binoclard*. Compl..."
links.text: That makes him a *binoclard*. Completely un-cop material, if you say so yourself.

links.title: Physical Instrument: "You feel a slight urge to put the l..."
links.text: You feel a slight urge to put the lieutenant down for this, but you can't quite muster enough testosterone.

links.title: You: ""Just observing.""
links.text: "Just observing."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I guess you *don't* need glasses,..."
links.text: "I guess you *don't* need glasses, then."

links.title: You: "(No, I don't.) "Glasses are cool, I..."
links.text: (No, I don't.) "Glasses are cool, I guess."

links.title: You: ""Kim, you're wearing a revolutionar..."
links.text: "Kim, you're wearing a revolutionary air brigade jacket, aren't you?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What, this?" he zips up the large..."
links.text: "What, this?" he zips up the large collar. "It's just seasonal clothing."

links.title: You: ""And those look like airman pants...."
links.text: "And those look like airman pants. Good for storing tools in."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He looks at his pants. "Where is th..."
links.text: He looks at his pants. "Where is this going?"

links.title: You: ""You see, Kim. I have this place in..."
links.text: "You see, Kim. I have this place in my head." (Point to your head.) "Where I develop new ideas and connections."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Interesting. I think it's called a..."
links.text: "Interesting. I think it's called a brain."

links.title: Conceptualization: "It's no mere brain."
links.text: It's no mere brain.

links.title: You: ""Yes. A brain.""
links.text: "Yes. A brain."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. And something happened in th..."
links.text: "Okay. And something happened in that brain?"

links.title: You: ""Yes. My brain suspects that you ha..."
links.text: "Yes. My brain suspects that you have some kind of *thing* with the revolutionary air brigades."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I do not have a *thing* with revol..."
links.text: "I do not have a *thing* with revolutionary air brigades in particular."

links.title: You: ""Just air brigades then?""
links.text: "Just air brigades then?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. I wanted to become an aerost..."
links.text: "Okay. I wanted to become an aerostatic pilot. Then I turned ten and realized we no longer have an air force."

links.title: You: ""Are you sure the *revolutionary* h..."
links.text: "Are you sure the *revolutionary* has got nothing to do with this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Absolutely nothing.""
links.text: "Absolutely nothing."

links.title: Drama: "The *revolutionary* must have added..."
links.text: The *revolutionary* must have added a little lustre to it, for a ten-year-old Kitsuragi. He will never admit it though.

links.title: Drama: "The *revolutionary* must have added..."
links.text: The *revolutionary* must have added a little lustre to it, for a ten-year-old Kitsuragi. He will never admit it though.

links.title: You: ""Absolutely nothing?""
links.text: "Absolutely nothing?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, I admit to it. The Revolutio..."
links.text: "Okay, I admit to it. The Revolution employed a more forward-looking eight-rotor design. Their blades were foldable and their pilots were better trained and motivated."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "He corrects his glasses. "I say thi..."
links.text: He corrects his glasses. "I say this from a purely tactical standpoint of course."

links.title: Empathy: "It is not from a *purely* tactical..."
links.text: It is not from a *purely* tactical standpoint. We are not ruling out that the lieutenant had a little... rebel phase in that past of his.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I've noticed -- and okay. The Revo..."
links.text: "I've noticed -- and okay. The Revolution employed a more forward-looking eight-rotor design. Their blades were foldable and their pilots were better trained and motivated."

links.title: You: ""Thank you. My mind is satisfied."..."
links.text: "Thank you. My mind is satisfied." (Point to your head again.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good." He glances impatiently at h..."
links.text: "Good." He glances impatiently at his electronic wristwatch.

links.title: You: ""That's all. I just wanted you to k..."
links.text: "That's all. I just wanted you to know I have this thing." (Keep pointing to your head.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And now I do," he nods."
links.text: "And now I do," he nods.

links.title: You: ""No, it's more than that. Anyway.""
links.text: "No, it's more than that. Anyway."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Anyway.""
links.text: "Anyway."

links.title: You: ""In this special place I have come..."
links.text: "In this special place I have come to suspect that you have some kind of *thing* with the revolutionary air brigades."

links.title: You: ""No, normal people don't have this...."
links.text: "No, normal people don't have this. It's like a mind laboratory. A spiritual R&D division. No, a pallet! No, better yet -- a painter's atelier of concepts!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay, Art Cop.""
links.text: "Okay, Art Cop."

links.title: You: ""Okay indeed. And in this *atelier*..."
links.text: "Okay indeed. And in this *atelier* I have realized that you harbour some kind of *sentiment* toward the revolutionary air brigades."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I do not harbour a sentiment for r..."
links.text: "I do not harbour a sentiment for revolutionary air brigades in particular."

links.title: You: ""Nowhere. Let's change the subject..."
links.text: "Nowhere. Let's change the subject -- but still keep it on *you*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Let's not.""
links.text: "Let's not."

links.title: You: ""You don't look like other people a..."
links.text: "You don't look like other people around here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's because I'm half-Seolite. O..."
links.text: "That's because I'm half-Seolite. Or quarter. My father's father was from Seol -- so was my grandmother, but from my mother's side..." He shakes his head. "It's not an interesting topic."

links.title: You: ""What is Seol?""
links.text: "What is Seol?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's a part of the world, officer...."
links.text: "It's a part of the world, officer. A geopolitical entity -- *and* a geographic division. I told you it wouldn't be interesting."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Seol is a protectionist, isolationi..."
links.text: Seol is a protectionist, isolationist panisiolary state west of the Insulindian isola. Actually, it's *quite* interesting; some would even say mysterious...

links.title: You: ""Okay, I guess it's not interesting..."
links.text: "Okay, I guess it's not interesting then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can see you're disappointed." A..."
links.text: "I can see you're disappointed." A brief smile. "You're right to be -- I don't speak a word of Seolite. I've never met either one of my grandparents. I've never been to Seol. I'm a regular, garden variety Revacholiere."

links.title: Rhetoric: "A point of pride to him."
links.text: A point of pride to him.

links.title: Empathy: "He's glad to have shot down your qu..."
links.text: He's glad to have shot down your question.

links.title: You: ""You're only making it *sound* unin..."
links.text: "You're only making it *sound* uninteresting. I still want to know more about Seol."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're barking up the wrong tree...."
links.text: "You're barking up the wrong tree. I don't speak a word of Seolite, I've never met either one of my grandparents. And I've never *been* to Seol." He seems almost proud of these things. "I'm a regular Revacholiere."

links.title: You: ""Okay then.""
links.text: "Okay then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Mhm. I don't speak a word of Seoli..."
links.text: "Mhm. I don't speak a word of Seolite and I've never met either one of my grandparents. There is nothing *ethnic* I can tell you. Or anyone else."

links.title: You: ""Tell me a secret about yourself.""
links.text: "Tell me a secret about yourself."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant narrows a single eye..."
links.text: The lieutenant narrows a single eyebrow. "No."

links.title: You: "Ask again."
links.text: Ask again.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "Your brain sends the signal to your..."
links.text: Your brain sends the signal to your lips but they refuse the order. Something is paralysing them. You're pretty sure it has something to do with the lieutenant's eyebrow.

links.title: Volition: "The eyebrow is exercising *psionic*..."
links.text: The eyebrow is exercising *psionic* control over you.

links.title: Composure: "It's like you're *locked down*."
links.text: It's like you're *locked down*.

links.title: You: "What's... happening... to me?"
links.text: What's... happening... to me?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Something the matter, detective?""
links.text: "Something the matter, detective?"
Goddamn right something's the matter! Lieutenant Eyebrow here thinks he can shut you down like some brow-less freak? Thinks you're just going to lie back and take it?!
Let's show him: Raise your brow high, up to high-noon.
Smugly, sire. Raise it smugly.
(Slowly raise your eyebrow.) "Nothing at all."
The lieutenant immediately grasps the stakes. His gears turn as he prepares a devastating counter. This could get ugly...
Your fingers trace the edges of an imaginary holster on your hip. A slight twitch runs through your index finger.
Now, counter his counter! Brow to the troposphere! Full hoist!
Put your neck into it. That's where the power comes from.
Keep your brow steady, but slowly nod your head as a flourish.
This seems dangerous. What if someone gets hurt?
Too late. The die is cast. This is street-style brow-fighting. Two of a kind but one won't survive.
(Raise it smugly.) "I don't know, *is* there?"
Reflexes take over, the lieutenant's brow meets yours: His fierce counter nearly tears your face off. This could get ugly...
(Raise it cautiously.) "You sure you wanna do this, Kim?"
After decades unchallenged, the lieutenant's reaction is a bit slow, but he's not letting you have this. Not for a second. This could get ugly...
(Jerk it like a powerlifter in a squat-cage.) "Your secrets, lieutenant -- Now!"
After decades unchallenged, the lieutenant is caught off-guard by your brazen provocation, but his counter comes fast and hard. This could get ugly...

links.title: Authority: "This guy's got Authority off the ch..."
links.text: This guy's got Authority off the charts. With just a flick of his eyebrow he's able to make you his thrall.

links.title: You: "So what can I *do* about it?"
links.text: So what can I *do* about it?

links.title: Authority: "*Nothing*. You better hope he doesn..."
links.text: *Nothing*. You better hope he doesn't abuse his authority. There's *a lot* of it.

links.title: You: "Silently scream for help."
links.text: Silently scream for help.

links.title: Authority: "If the lieutenant were an *evil* ma..."
links.text: If the lieutenant were an *evil* man, who knows what sort of havoc he could wreak?

links.title: Empathy: "Fortunately he is a committed offic..."
links.text: Fortunately he is a committed officer of the RCM. He'll only use his powers for the good of the investigation.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant relaxes his eyebrow,..."
links.text: The lieutenant relaxes his eyebrow, and you seem to regain control of yourself.

links.title: You: "Accept your thralldom."
links.text: Accept your thralldom.

links.title: Authority: "What's going on? It's like you're a..."
links.text: What's going on? It's like you're a puppet in his hands.

links.title: You: "Give up. There's nothing you can do..."
links.text: Give up. There's nothing you can do.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant relaxes his eyebrow,..."
links.text: The lieutenant relaxes his eyebrow, and you seem to regain control of yourself.

links.title: You: ""Oh, okay.""
links.text: "Oh, okay."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant nods."
links.text: The lieutenant nods.

links.title: You: ""Do you ever *talk* with yourself?""
links.text: "Do you ever *talk* with yourself?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: You: ""You know, when you're thinking. Do..."
links.text: "You know, when you're thinking. Do you ever have *conversations* with, like, your brain?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I have no idea what you're talking..."
links.text: "I have no idea what you're talking about."

links.title: Conceptualization: "The lieutenant's Conceptualization..."
links.text: The lieutenant's Conceptualization skills must be rather *rudimentary*.

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "The lieutenant is a police officer..."
links.text: The lieutenant is a police officer of the *old school*. His concerns are material and extrinsic.

links.title: Conceptualization: "But this isn't an *old school* case..."
links.text: But this isn't an *old school* case.

links.title: You: ""I get it -- You're one of those *o..."
links.text: "I get it -- You're one of those *old school* detectives." (Nod respectfully.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So, what? That makes *you* the *ne..."
links.text: "So, what? That makes *you* the *new school*? Gods spare us..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""For real detective work, nothing b..."
links.text: "For real detective work, nothing beats a good notebook by your side..."

links.title: You: ""So how do you... you know..." (Tap..."
links.text: "So how do you... you know..." (Tap the side of your head.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What, *think*? I do most of my wor..."
links.text: "What, *think*? I do most of my work inside my notebook..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant produces his small b..."
links.text: The lieutenant produces his small blue notebook and idly thumbs through a few pages.

links.title: Empathy: "That's where his conversations with..."
links.text: That's where his conversations with himself take place.

links.title: Conceptualization: "We all have our different mediums...."
links.text: We all have our different mediums. His is written.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "You're super lucid -- yet psychedel..."
links.text: You're super lucid -- yet psychedelic. You don't need office supplies to connect to your nervous system, you're *special*.

links.title: You: ""So you're saying your brain *never..."
links.text: "So you're saying your brain *never* just chimes in with advice or warnings or *anything*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can't say that it does, no. When..."
links.text: "I can't say that it does, no. When I need to think, I just use my notebook..."

links.title: You: ""That's all for now." (Conclude.)"
links.text: "That's all for now." (Conclude.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. Let's change the subject.""
links.text: "Good. Let's change the subject."

links.title: You: "(Stroke your chin thoughtfully.) "I..."
links.text: (Stroke your chin thoughtfully.) "I've always believed in mind over matter."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's good to hear. I have little..."
links.text: "That's good to hear. I have little patience for the *swinging dick* style of police work. It's patience and intelligence that solves cases... Was there anything else?"

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What in the name of hell was *that..."
dialogueTree.text: "What in the name of hell was *that* supposed to be?!" The lieutenant is gritting his teeth.

links.title: You: ""Talk of this..." (Consider the phr..."
links.text: "Talk of this..." (Consider the phrasing.) "...pissing competition worries me. What stupidity is this?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The *cop* kind. Our Precincts can'..."
links.text: "The *cop* kind. Our Precincts can't decide if Martinaise is part of Jamrock or the Industrial Harbour. *Yours* or *mine*, as if we somehow *own* parts of the city. Typical street-gang mentality.... so we've let the Union make a mockery of law enforcement here. And now it's come to its natural conclusion."

links.title: You: ""Ah, so this is a struggle over *wh..."
links.text: "Ah, so this is a struggle over *who runs Martinaise*!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Well, sort of. It's less a matter..."
links.text: "Well, sort of. It's less a matter of who *gets* to police Martinaise than who *has* to. It's an orphan district, in other words..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I think the dispatch desk just tol..."
links.text: "I think the dispatch desk just told both our stations about the hanging. There was quite the brouhaha at the 57th, I can tell you that. 'Time to *settle it*', they said, '*Cop Off*'. But..." He leans in: "I assure you, I am not their *finest* or *toughest*, with *one hundred-and-two cases solved*. What I am is *least interested in a pissing competition*."

links.title: Reaction Speed: "So he volunteered to represent the..."
links.text: So he volunteered to represent the 57th, but not out of competitiveness -- on the contrary.

links.title: Encyclopedia: "Somewhere in your mind hangs a dark..."
links.text: Somewhere in your mind hangs a dark green blackboard. There are two columns. One says: "cases solved", the other: "confirmed kills".

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What is this place?" The lieutenan..."
dialogueTree.text: "What is this place?" The lieutenant stares at the dusty training equipment.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you ask me, it's high time for..."
links.text: "If you ask me, it's high time for you to put the bottle away. Sober up, get back to basics. That would be my advice."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""And I hope we don't even need to d..."
links.text: "And I hope we don't even need to discuss the *street drugs* you've been abusing..."

links.title: You: ""Oh, I'm not giving up drinking. It..."
links.text: "Oh, I'm not giving up drinking. It's what got me where I am today!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant's quizzical expressi..."
links.text: The lieutenant's quizzical expression gradually deepens into a frown.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So what *are* we talking about, th..."
links.text: "So what *are* we talking about, then?"

links.title: You: ""I'm talking about *la responsabili..."
links.text: "I'm talking about *la responsabilité*. You know, the kind that gets assigned."

links.title: You: ""At least let me have my cigarettes..."
links.text: "At least let me have my cigarettes, Kim. I only smoke them for the bonuses."

links.title: You: ""I can't give up street drugs now...."
links.text: "I can't give up street drugs now. I *just* got addicted to them!"

links.title: You: ""No, no. I meant like *la responsab..."
links.text: "No, no. I meant like *la responsabilité*. You know, the kind that gets assigned."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Why are you pronouncing it like yo..."
links.text: "Why are you pronouncing it like you're a Coalition bureaucrat?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know what? Forget it. What *sp..."
links.text: "You know what? Forget it. What *specifically* are you trying to assign responsibility *for*?"

links.title: You: "(Point to the ground.) "For the mur..."
links.text: (Point to the ground.) "For the murder."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But isn't that *our* job?""
links.text: "But isn't that *our* job?"

links.title: You: ""No, it's way more nuanced than tha..."
links.text: "No, it's way more nuanced than that. There's like this whole historical or socio-economic dimension to it."

links.title: You: "(Point to yourself.) "For my disast..."
links.text: (Point to yourself.) "For my disaster of a life."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""But isn't that *your* job?""
links.text: "But isn't that *your* job?"

links.title: You: "(Spread your arms wide.) "For this..."
links.text: (Spread your arms wide.) "For this *whole situation*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, now I understand..." The lieut..."
links.text: "Ah, now I understand..." The lieutenant nods his head gravely.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Next I suppose you're going to tel..."
links.text: "Next I suppose you're going to tell me you need to form a *committee* to assign this *responsabilité*?"

links.title: You: ""Yes, exactly.""
links.text: "Yes, exactly."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Fascinating. And here I believed y..."
links.text: "Fascinating. And here I believed your recent turn toward moralism was just an act."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In any event, I am just a humble l..."
links.text: "In any event, I am just a humble law official. I may work under the Moralintern's umbrella, but I'm certainly not qualified to serve on any 'committee'."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know who might be, though? Tha..."
links.text: "You know who might be, though? That Mr. Villedrouin, the uh... gentleman you needlessly antagonised in the apartments..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know who might be, though? Tha..."
links.text: "You know who might be, though? That Mr. Villedrouin, the uh... gentleman you met in the young man's apartment..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If I were trying to get in touch w..."
links.text: "If I were trying to get in touch with the Coalition, I would start by seeking him out. But first you might need to speak with his *young companion*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You know who might be, though? Tha..."
links.text: "You know who might be, though? That Mr. Heidelstam, the gentleman near the Feld building with the... distinctive way of speaking."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you're serious about this, you..."
links.text: "If you're serious about this, you might keep your eyes out for any Coalition officials we might happen to run across."

links.title: You: ""How did you know?""
links.text: "How did you know?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Simple, because Moralintern types..."
links.text: "Simple, because Moralintern types *love* to form committees."

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Khm..." Having looked away during..."
dialogueTree.text: "Khm..." Having looked away during the final phase of your little episode, the lieutenant now addresses you.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""When you said before that you were..."
dialogueTree.text: "When you said before that you were *down with racism* -- was it meant in earnest or were you just trying to win his confidence?"

links.title: You: ""I know, I know -- stunning, right?""
links.text: "I know, I know -- stunning, right?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Uhhh..." He scratches his cheek. "..."
links.text: "Uhhh..." He scratches his cheek. "I'm really not sure about this turn of events. I may have preferred the mutton chops. They sort of seemed to... cover up the..." He stops.

links.title: Endurance: "Damage."
links.text: Damage.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Yeah -- damage. He means damage."
links.text: Yeah -- damage. He means damage.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Either way, good on you." The lieu..."
links.text: "Either way, good on you." The lieutenant gathers himself. "You were saying...?"

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""We should think about calling it a..."
dialogueTree.text: "We should think about calling it a day, maybe? The nights are still miserably cold this time of year."

links.title: You: ""I didn't know they *let* binoclard..."
links.text: "I didn't know they *let* binoclards become cops."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant's face turns a ruddy..."
links.text: The lieutenant's face turns a ruddy shade. "I can *assure* you, detective, that I've passed *all* the required physical exams within the last year. Can you say the same?"

links.title: You: "(I'm not gonna call him a bino.) "G..."
links.text: (I'm not gonna call him a bino.) "Glasses are cool."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are they? They're mostly just cumb..."
links.text: "Are they? They're mostly just cumbersome."

links.title: Perception (Sight): "You could use a good, *normal* pair..."
links.text: You could use a good, *normal* pair yourself.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Morning." He gives you a quick nod..."
dialogueTree.text: "Morning." He gives you a quick nod.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Any theories about what happened h..."
dialogueTree.text: "Any theories about what happened here?" He gazes down at the sign.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Not a fan. It's just the nature of..."
links.text: "Not a fan. It's just the nature of lieutenancy."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The RCM deploys a self-styled struc..."
links.text: The RCM deploys a self-styled structure called the Décomptage as its chain of command. Every lieutenant is responsible for two sergeants and eight officers. That means the average lieutenant has to deal with quite a few personal affairs. Even you know this.

links.title: You: ""So what *should* I concentrate on?""
links.text: "So what *should* I concentrate on?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Try work. The case at hand. It can..."
links.text: "Try work. The case at hand. It can work miracles."

links.title: You: ""But I'm completely lacking in basi..."
links.text: "But I'm completely lacking in basic information about even this organization we're in. Can you help me?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Fine. We should get through the da..."
links.text: "Fine. We should get through the day first. Off-hours begin at 21:00. If you're still having trouble then, I can give you an orientation."

links.title: You: ""I'm afraid this is a medical situa..."
links.text: "I'm afraid this is a medical situation." (Move on.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Really?" The lieutenant gives you..."
links.text: "Really?" The lieutenant gives you a look, thorough as if performing triage. "You look fine to me."

links.title: You: ""I'm talking deep, neurological dam..."
links.text: "I'm talking deep, neurological damage here."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This psycho-drama is unbecoming of..."
links.text: "This psycho-drama is unbecoming of an officer."

links.title: Logic: "Clearly he prefers to think you're..."
links.text: Clearly he prefers to think you're malingering. He cannot fathom that anyone could drink so much as to retroactively erase their entire life.

links.title: You: ""It's not psychological. Some sort..."
links.text: "It's not psychological. Some sort of major brain damage has occurred. On an unprecedented scale."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You can always use the radio in my..."
links.text: "You can always use the radio in my Kineema to call your station's lazareth again. Was there anything else you wanted?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then you should consider seeking m..."
links.text: "Then you should consider seeking medical attention. You can use the radio in my Kineema to call your station's *lazareth*. Was there anything else you wanted?"

links.title: You: ""I'm talking serious, unbelievable..."
links.text: "I'm talking serious, unbelievable damage here."

links.title: You: ""Okay, then.""
links.text: "Okay, then."

links.title: You: ""Fine." (Let it be.)"
links.text: "Fine." (Let it be.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Focus on *other* people's troubles..."
links.text: "Focus on *other* people's troubles. Not your own. That is the relief."

links.title: Half Light: "Your heart beats twice, like a fist..."
links.text: Your heart beats twice, like a fist. The serotonin deficiency makes your teeth clench.

links.title: You: ""Thank you, oh wise man.""
links.text: "Thank you, oh wise man."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant blinks, his mouth sl..."
links.text: The lieutenant blinks, his mouth slightly open and his body motionless. A microsecond passes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Excuse me. I was lecturing you. I..."
links.text: "Excuse me. I was lecturing you. I shouldn't have. You should consult a medical professional if you feel that you need help."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "This habit of dispensing wisdom has..."
links.text: This habit of dispensing wisdom has been brought to his attention before. He will not think less of you for lashing out -- he is trying to curb it.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Excuse me. I was lecturing you. I..."
links.text: "Excuse me. I was lecturing you. I shouldn't have. You should consult a medical professional if you feel that you need help. You can use the radio in my Kineema to call your station's *lazareth*."

links.title: You: "Say nothing."
links.text: Say nothing.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant glances at his elect..."
links.text: The lieutenant glances at his electronic wristwatch.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This might be just the place to he..."
dialogueTree.text: "This might be just the place to help you rectify your... financial situation."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A good joke.""
links.text: "A good joke."

links.title: Empathy: "He does not actually think it was a..."
links.text: He does not actually think it was a good joke.

links.title: You: ""Yes, a joke. In truth I will only..."
links.text: "Yes, a joke. In truth I will only moderately humiliate and outperform you."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Oh? You will?" He raises his colla..."
links.text: "Oh? You will?" He raises his collar. His eyes narrow. "Then I will *help* you to do so. Now..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Still, against his better judgement..."
links.text: Still, against his better judgement, this made him think just a little bit less of you

links.title: You: ""A joke, of course. Rest assured, I..."
links.text: "A joke, of course. Rest assured, I have no intention to compete with you."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's good we set this thing aside.""
links.text: "It's good we set this thing aside."

links.title: You: ""Of course it's a joke, look at me!..."
links.text: "Of course it's a joke, look at me! How could I compete with you, you probably have a ton of cases solved."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's not that many. Officer, I'm s..."
links.text: "It's not that many. Officer, I'm sure you have a lot more cases solved. Now..."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Strangely enough, it's not pity. He..."
links.text: Strangely enough, it's not pity. He would never pity a fellow officer. He truly appears to think you've solved your fair share of cases -- perhaps more than him.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""This is not going quite as I hoped..."
dialogueTree.text: "This is not going quite as I hoped it would, detective." The lieutenant's voice is hushed.

links.title: You: ""Okay, it was a poor joke. But we c..."
links.text: "Okay, it was a poor joke. But we could use a good mannered Cop Off, don't you agree?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If it helps you work better, okay...."
links.text: "If it helps you work better, okay. See it as competition. But don't expect me to. Now..."

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Officer, what was that?""
dialogueTree.text: "Officer, what was that?"

links.text: Gradually turn your head and let your brow rise untethered.
The lieutenant anticipates your move but can neither deflect nor parry your counter-counter assault. A single drop of sweat trickles down his cheek...
Hold steady...

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Alright, we're finished here. Let'..."
dialogueTree.text: "Alright, we're finished here. Let's quickly debrief and go over what we found -- so we don't do it in front of the company rep."

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Looks like we have more to discuss..."
dialogueTree.text: "Looks like we have more to discuss with those so-called *Hardie boys*." His voice is lowered. "Half their reasoning just went out the window."

links.text: It's barely a secret. Everyone's smoked hemp.
"That's not a secret. Everyone has smoked cannabis."
"No, there are couple of people who haven't smoked cannabis. I'm sure of that."
There's a hint of defensiveness in his voice. Even this minor act of rebellion is important to the lieutenant's self-construction.
"Relax, Kim. I'm down with hemp."
"It's not a big deal. I don't do it any more." An almost imperceptible sigh. "But it happened a few times. In my twenties."
"We should hit a blunt some time."
"How about we 'hit' the crime we came here for instead. And by 'hit' I mean 'solve' it. Solve it *hard*."
"Besides, those days are long behind me."
The words are true, milord. No love for the herb in the lieutenant.
"You know I have to take this to Internal Affairs, don't you, lieutenant?"
"Of course. Here's my gun and my badge." His hands reach out empty. "They'll put me in the chaise for this, but it feels good to have it off my chest."
The *chaise electrique*?
"You're serious right now?"
"Yes." He nods. "Let's hurry now, I'm living on borrowed time."
He's not. It's all but a ruse, sire. The lieutenant's peculiar sense of humor.
"Very funny, lieutenant."
"Good." Only a fraction of a smirk in the corner of his mouth betrays his amusement. "But enough of this. Was there anything else?"
"Let's move on. This has been enough of a detour."
"Agreed." Only a fraction of a smirk in the corner of his mouth betrays his amusement. "Was there anything else?"
"You brought this on yourself."
"All I ask is the chance to close this final case so I can go to the chaise with a clean conscience." His voice is filled with mock pathos. "Let's hurry, I'm living on borrowed time."
"Sure. There was actually something else I was wondering about..."
"Yes?" His eyebrows remain completely level.
"Kim, you son of a bitch..."
"I appreciate the honesty, lieutenant."

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'd appreciate it if you didn't fo..."
dialogueTree.text: "I'd appreciate it if you didn't force us into situations where I may have to shoot random civilians. Because that won't get us anywhere."

links.title: You: ""What's wrong with personal affairs?""
links.text: "What's wrong with personal affairs?"

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. What do you think is going o..."
dialogueTree.text: "Okay. What do you think is going on with that computer, chalkboard, and fireplace?"

links.title: Half Light: "Oh no, you're a cop, you can't go t..."
links.text: Oh no, you're a cop, you can't go to jail...

links.title: Drama: "LIE! LIE TO GET OUT OF IT!"
links.text: LIE! LIE TO GET OUT OF IT!

links.title: You: ""You are?""
links.text: "You are?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It was a joke, sadly. There's noth..."
links.text: "It was a joke, sadly. There's nothing I can do about your delinquency." He sighs. "What's done is done. Let's get back to policework."

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "I don't care about your insane thef..."
links.text: I don't care about your insane theft, the lieutenant thinks and looks away from the boots. Just know: if anyone asks me, I *will* snitch on you.

links.title: You: ""Please don't, I was just...""
links.text: "Please don't, I was just..."

links.title: You: ""These are not the same boots. I li..."
links.text: "These are not the same boots. I liked them so much I went and bought myself a pair."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sure." He nods. "Anyway, did you w..."
links.text: "Sure." He nods. "Anyway, did you want something -- related to policework?"

links.title: You: ""You're joking.""
links.text: "You're joking."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Am I?" He arches his brow. "Anyway..."
links.text: "Am I?" He arches his brow. "Anyway, did you want something -- related to policework?"

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You did well," the lieutenant says..."
dialogueTree.text: "You did well," the lieutenant says as soon as you've left the apartment. The balcony feels cool and quiet, with a stunning view over the district.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""So, the death notification..." the..."
dialogueTree.text: "So, the death notification..." the lieutenant says as soon as you've left the apartment.

links.text: Heavy drops of rain fall on the colliding eyebrows and run down the worn faces. The world outside this stand-off almost doesn't exist.
Snowflakes fall and immediately melt in the heat of the colliding eyebrows. Nothing exists outside this moment.
It's as if the entire world is frozen solid in awe of this great clash of brows. Nothing exists outside this moment.
An almost unbearable tension fills the room. The hairs of your back stand up.
An almost imperceptible snap inside the lieutenant. His shoulders relax, his eyebrow casually descending as he tries his best to look relaxed, nonchalant even.
A graceful retreat. So smooth you'd almost think there was no battle at all.
There, you've breached his defenses. His secrets are yours.
"Alright, I guess there is *one* thing..."
"I have, on a few occasions -- when I was young and foolish -- smoked hemp."
Tetrahydrocannabinol is the psychoactive substance in the cannabis plant, commonly known as 'hemp'. It's one of the most common recreational substances in the world.
The lieutenant is a narcomaniac!
He's waiting for a reaction.
"Is that secret enough for you?"
"Smoked... what?"
"The hemp," he repeats. "Cannabis. Is that secret enough for you?"
"You mean cannabis?"
"Yes, cannabis. The hemp. I rolled it into a small paper tube and lit in on fire. Then I *inhaled* the fumes. I was young."
"Is that enough of a secret for you?"
He's waiting for a reaction.

dialogueTree.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes?""
dialogueTree.text: "Yes?"

links.title: You: ""Hold still a second..." (Try to sm..."
links.text: "Hold still a second..." (Try to smell Kim.)

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant's posture becomes ri..."
links.text: The lieutenant's posture becomes rigid and uncomfortable as you lean forward and sniff the area just above his shoulder blade...

links.title: Perception (Smell): "The lieutenant is fastidious as a c..."
links.text: The lieutenant is fastidious as a cat in matters of his personal upkeep. And yet, in the folds of his jacket you can just perceive the stale and acrid traces of oil rags, transmission fluid, and brake pads.

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Wait-wait. There's something else t..."
links.text: Wait-wait. There's something else there, something that sets your GABA-receptors aflutter.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "The lieutenant's aftershave. A comm..."
links.text: The lieutenant's aftershave. A common drugstore brand. Strong hints of pine needle.

links.title: Rhetoric: "But what sort of *ideological* pict..."
links.text: But what sort of *ideological* picture do these smells paint? Tough to say...

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do you *need* something, detective?""
links.text: "Do you *need* something, detective?"

links.title: You: ""I was just wondering what brand of..."
links.text: "I was just wondering what brand of aftershave you use."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It's nothing fancy, just plain old..."
links.text: "It's nothing fancy, just plain old Taiga Super Special..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I do like the way it tingles, thou..."
links.text: "I do like the way it tingles, though. It's the only part of shaving I actually look forward to."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Was there something else you wishe..."
links.text: "Was there something else you wished to discuss?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Are you thinking of... you know?"..."
links.text: "Are you thinking of... you know?" He gestures toward his cheeks with an invisible razor.

links.title: You: ""Lose *these* bad boys? No way.""
links.text: "Lose *these* bad boys? No way."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I didn't mean to offend. It's your..."
links.text: "I didn't mean to offend. It's your business, of course."

links.title: You: ""Do you think I should?""
links.text: "Do you think I should?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant considers your mutto..."
links.text: The lieutenant considers your muttonchops for a long moment. A slight grimace crosses his face.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sorry, I'm really no expert on thi..."
links.text: "Sorry, I'm really no expert on this sort of thing..."

links.title: You: ""Just as I suspected: You're no lie..."
links.text: "Just as I suspected: You're no lieutenant... you're a *mechanic*!"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I do like to *hang around* the mot..."
links.text: "I do like to *hang around* the motor pool every now and then, but that doesn't make me a mechanic."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Sort of like how hanging around th..."
links.text: "Sort of like how hanging around the liquor store hasn't made you into a master distiller."

links.title: You: ""Hey! I've been doing better.""
links.text: "Hey! I've been doing better."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You're right, detective. My apolog..."
links.text: "You're right, detective. My apologies."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Was there something else you wishe..."
links.text: "Was there something else you wished to discuss?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's a good point. It could happ..."
links.text: "That's a good point. It could happen any day now."

links.title: You: ""That was a cheap shot.""
links.text: "That was a cheap shot."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""My apologies, detective. I couldn'..."
links.text: "My apologies, detective. I couldn't resist."

links.title: You: ""Nope, we're good.""
links.text: "Nope, we're good."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""... Alright then.""
links.text: "... Alright then."

links.title: Perception (Smell): "He smells... like a man? A perfectl..."
links.text: He smells... like a man? A perfectly normal man?

links.title: Electrochemistry: "Wait-wait. There's *something* ther..."
links.text: Wait-wait. There's *something* there, something that sets your GABA-receptors aflutter.

links.title: Perception (Smell): "The lieutenant's aftershave. A comm..."
links.text: The lieutenant's aftershave. A common drugstore brand. Strong hints of pine needle.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Strange. You're not getting any str..."
links.text: Strange. You're not getting any strong *ideological whiffs* from the lieutenant.

links.title: You: ""Kim! We need to talk about... *res..."
links.text: "Kim! We need to talk about... *responsibility*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, I'm glad to hear it, detective..."
links.text: "Ah, I'm glad to hear it, detective. I was wondering when we'd get to this very subject."

links.title: You: ""Good. We're on the same page then.""
links.text: "Good. We're on the same page then."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you ask me, it's past time for..."
links.text: "If you ask me, it's past time for you to cut back on the smoking. You seem like a man with a death wish. It's quite disturbing."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you ask me, it's past time for..."
links.text: "If you ask me, it's past time for you to lay off the *street drugs* you've been abusing. They really aren't helping us solve the case."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""If you ask me, it's high time for..."
links.text: "If you ask me, it's high time for you to set aside these frivolous *side tasks* and focus 100% of your energies on the case before us."

links.title: You: ""What do you mean?""
links.text: "What do you mean?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To be completely honest, detective..."
links.text: "To be completely honest, detective, I've been meaning to raise that very subject with you."

links.title: You: ""So..." (Point to your face.) "I sh..."
links.text: "So..." (Point to your face.) "I shaved."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Yes, uhm..." The lieutenant stares..."
links.text: "Yes, uhm..." The lieutenant stares at your shaven face, his eyes narrowed. "Uhhhh..." he mumbles. "I don't know what to say." He coughs. "Perhaps..."

links.title: You: ""What is it? You can tell me, Kim.""
links.text: "What is it? You can tell me, Kim."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm not really sure about this tur..."
links.text: "I'm not really sure about this turn of events. I... think the mutton chops might have been a better idea. They sort of seemed to cover up some of the..." He stops.

links.title: You: ""I knew I shouldn't shave! I knew i..."
links.text: "I knew I shouldn't shave! I knew it and still did it. What an idiot..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No-no, it's... okay, I guess." He..."
links.text: "No-no, it's... okay, I guess." He keeps staring at you, dumbfounded. "I may have preferred the mutton chops, they sort of seemed to... cover the..." He stops.

links.title: You: ""Aren't we going to talk about the..."
links.text: "Aren't we going to talk about the boots I'm wearing?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay -- let's *talk* about it. You..."
links.text: "Okay -- let's *talk* about it. You stole the boots." He looks at the gleaming technological footwear you're sporting.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Congratulations. That must have ta..."
links.text: "Congratulations. That must have taken an enormous, concerted effort. *Considerable* ingenuity. And timing. Now -- I'm going to report you and you're going to go to jail."

links.title: You: ""I found out what the *pale* is whi..."
links.text: "I found out what the *pale* is while you were gone."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Wonderful." He does not seem surpr..."
links.text: "Wonderful." He does not seem surprised. "What is your takeaway?"

links.title: You: ""Wait, you're not surprised?""
links.text: "Wait, you're not surprised?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can't stop a grown man from lear..."
links.text: "I can't stop a grown man from learning about the fundamental geographic and entroponetic features of our world, can I?"

links.title: Esprit de Corps: "Perhaps I shouldn't have tried, he..."
links.text: Perhaps I shouldn't have tried, he thinks.

links.title: Rhetoric: "Perhaps I was overprotective, is wh..."
links.text: Perhaps I was overprotective, is what's insinuated.

links.title: You: ""I think it's terrifying.""
links.text: "I think it's terrifying."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then I was right to spare you from..."
links.text: "Then I was right to spare you from it, no?" He cracks a little smile. "Anyway, the pale is no more terrifying than, say, water. Or death. Or that we're stuck behind our eyes, for all eternity..." He looks around, pensive suddenly.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Excuse me. Large topics are not my..."
links.text: "Excuse me. Large topics are not my forte. You seem stable enough. Keep it that way. Now -- was there anything else or should we get to it?"

links.title: You: ""It seems unreal.""
links.text: "It seems unreal."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It *all* seems unreal, detective...."
links.text: "It *all* seems unreal, detective. In actuality, the pale is no more unreal than, say, water. Or death. Or that we're stuck behind our eyes, between our own ears, talking..." He looks around, pensive suddenly.

links.title: You: ""I'm super cool with all of it.""
links.text: "I'm super cool with all of it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm glad to hear that. I'm glad to..."
links.text: "I'm glad to hear that. I'm glad to see you're stable." He nods approvingly. "Keep it that way. Now -- was there anything else, or should we get to it?"

links.title: You: ""Where *are* we, Lieutenant Kitsura..."
links.text: "Where *are* we, Lieutenant Kitsuragi?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""In Elysium," he replies. "Behind o..."
links.text: "In Elysium," he replies. "Behind our eyes. Like all human beings, detective." He looks around and sighs. "The world is what it is. I'm glad to see you're stable. Keep it that way."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now -- was there anything else or..."
links.text: "Now -- was there anything else or should we get to it?"

links.title: You: ""Tell me about the case again.""
links.text: "Tell me about the case again."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""What do you want to know?""
links.text: "What do you want to know?"

links.title: You: ""Literally *anything* about it -- I..."
links.text: "Literally *anything* about it -- I can't remember a single thing."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, yes. The case brief you missed..."
links.text: "Ah, yes. The case brief you missed. Now I remember." He opens his notes.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Maybe you can tell me what you *do..."
links.text: "Maybe you can tell me what you *do* know? To help me narrow it down a bit."

links.title: You: ""A young woman told me a mercenary..."
links.text: "A young woman told me a mercenary has been hanged, and the manager thinks it was the Union that did it. That's all."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then you're not that far behind, a..."
links.text: "Then you're not that far behind, actually. Do you want me to brief you?"

links.title: You: ""A young woman told me a mercenary'..."
links.text: "A young woman told me a mercenary's been hanged -- that's all."

links.title: You: ""The guy behind the counter thinks..."
links.text: "The guy behind the counter thinks some Union people hanged a man."

links.title: You: ""I know literally nothing about it...."
links.text: "I know literally nothing about it. Only what you told me before."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do you want me to brief you?""
links.text: "Do you want me to brief you?"

links.title: You: ""What did your preliminary informat..."
links.text: "What did your preliminary information say about it? Before you came here?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You mean like a brief? Do you want..."
links.text: "You mean like a brief? Do you want me to brief you?"

links.title: You: ""*Brief*, yes. That sounds good.""
links.text: "*Brief*, yes. That sounds good."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Three days ago, the RCM Emergencie..."
links.text: "Three days ago, the RCM Emergencies Desk received a report about a security guard who was found hanged in Martinaise. An anonymous caller said there was a dead body behind the Whirling-in-Rags hostel-cafeteria. The cadaver had been there for four days -- no one had come to investigate..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""During that time, the victim had b..."
links.text: "During that time, the victim had been stripped of his belongings. The caller did not identify him, but used the word *lynching*. There is an ongoing labour dispute between the local dockworkers and the logistics company Wild Pines. I was told we should approach the death as part of this dispute."

links.title: You: ""Wait, does the briefing say who th..."
links.text: "Wait, does the briefing say who the victim was?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""A security guard or worker of some..."
links.text: "A security guard or worker of some sort, hired by Wild Pines. This was just hearsay from Martinaise, of course. We need to find out the truth."

links.title: You: ""Who was the caller?""
links.text: "Who was the caller?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""To find him or her is one of our t..."
links.text: "To find him or her is one of our tasks here. For now all we know is that the tone was muffled using a device of some sort -- the desk could identify neither the caller's age nor sex."

links.title: You: ""Why hide themselves?""
links.text: "Why hide themselves?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's a strong prejudice against..."
links.text: "There's a strong prejudice against involving the RCM in what's seen as *Union matters*. The Dockworkers' Union is the de facto police in Martinaise. Now -- it appears -- they've started executing too. We cannot allow that."

links.title: You: ""Hold on, and the RCM is?""
links.text: "Hold on, and the RCM is?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's us. The Revachol Citizens M..."
links.text: "That's us. The Revachol Citizens Militia. We're the police in this city."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "The RCM, or the Revachol Citizens M..."
links.text: The RCM, or the Revachol Citizens Militia, is the police force you and him are part of. A self-organized peace corps of the occupied city of Revachol, the RCM operates within a legal twilight, yet its authority is rarely questioned. It's *super useful* to know this.

links.title: You: ""Of course. Yes. I understand every..."
links.text: "Of course. Yes. I understand everything now."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Just to be clear -- we are police..."
links.text: "Just to be clear -- we are police officers. It's our job to find the killer. That's the case. Uncover and arrest the killer."

links.title: You: ""Let me just make this perfectly cl..."
links.text: "Let me just make this perfectly clear -- our job here... is to find *the killer*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""That's right.""
links.text: "That's right."

links.title: You: ""I still don't understand anything.""
links.text: "I still don't understand anything."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay. Well. We are police officers..."
links.text: "Okay. Well. We are police officers. It is our job to find the killer. So that's what I intend to do. You should try too."

links.title: You: ""Why didn't we know anything about..."
links.text: "Why didn't we know anything about the caller?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They -- Klaasje, as we've come to..."
links.text: "They -- Klaasje, as we've come to suspect -- didn't identify themselves in any way. The tone was muffled using a device of some sort. The desk could identify neither the caller's age nor sex."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""They didn't identify themselves in..."
links.text: "They didn't identify themselves in any way. The tone was muffled using a device of some sort. The desk could identify neither the caller's age nor sex."

links.title: You: ""Mega cool. I've heard enough.""
links.text: "Mega cool. I've heard enough."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Okay then. Was there anything else..."
links.text: "Okay then. Was there anything else you wanted to know?"

links.title: You: ""No. I'll wing it.""
links.text: "No. I'll wing it."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""There's no reason to *wing* anythi..."
links.text: "There's no reason to *wing* anything. If you didn't get the brief, that's okay, I did."

links.title: You: ""Can we go over the preliminary inf..."
links.text: "Can we go over the preliminary info again?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""You mean like a brief? Do you want..."
links.text: "You mean like a brief? Do you want me to brief you again?"

links.title: You: ""Would you say this is a *mysteriou..."
links.text: "Would you say this is a *mysterious* case?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: "The lieutenant considers your quest..."
links.text: The lieutenant considers your question a moment. Before answering: "No, it's not a particularly mysterious case."

links.title: You: ""Why not?""
links.text: "Why not?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""The deceased is a security guard f..."
links.text: "The deceased is a security guard for a corporation involved in a labour dispute. It doesn't take a Dolorian polymath to put the pieces together. I just don't see the case getting more *mysterious* than that."

links.title: You: ""I was thinking something other-wor..."
links.text: "I was thinking something other-worldly might be involved. You know, something *supra-natural*."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I can assure nothing like that wil..."
links.text: "I can assure nothing like that will happen. Do you know why not?"

links.title: Rhetoric: "He's about to say it's impossible."
links.text: He's about to say it's impossible.

links.title: You: ""Are you sure? I think something is..."
links.text: "Are you sure? I think something is already happening."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""No, something isn't happening. Bec..."
links.text: "No, something isn't happening. Because it's not part of..." He makes a precise hand gesture: "Reality."

links.title: Composure: "The gesture resembles an orchestra..."
links.text: The gesture resembles an orchestra conductor bringing the choir to a full stop.

links.title: You: ""Why not?""
links.text: "Why not?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Because it's not part of..." He ma..."
links.text: "Because it's not part of..." He makes a precise hand gesture: "Reality."

links.title: You: ""Because it's impossible, I know th..."
links.text: "Because it's impossible, I know that. Still..."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Good. Yes. Because it's not part o..."
links.text: "Good. Yes. Because it's not part of Reality."

links.title: Conceptualization: "So desperately mundane. You need to..."
links.text: So desperately mundane. You need to funk this case up.

links.title: Inland Empire: "There's something the lieutenant is..."
links.text: There's something the lieutenant isn't seeing. The universe is too irrational, too morally complex. You should convince him.

links.title: You: ""White male in his forties -- what..."
links.text: "White male in his forties -- what more do you need?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I'm relieved that you agree," he s..."
links.text: "I'm relieved that you agree," he says, then pauses.

links.title: Empathy: "He is glad and surprised to see an..."
links.text: He is glad and surprised to see an officer who can appreciate the less-than spectacular.

links.title: You: ""Is there anything else? You look l..."
links.text: "Is there anything else? You look like you were about to say something."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Do you know the feeling when you'v..."
links.text: "Do you know the feeling when you've begun filling in a crossword but some of your answers don't quite seem to fit? That's the feeling I have right now, for some reason..."

links.title: You: ""I know exactly what you mean.""
links.text: "I know exactly what you mean."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""It will turn into quite the puzzle..."
links.text: "It will turn into quite the puzzle yet, I'm afraid..." The lieutenant nods.

links.title: You: ""I have no idea what you mean.""
links.text: "I have no idea what you mean."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Hmm, perhaps you're a more profici..."
links.text: "Hmm, perhaps you're a more proficient *cruciverbalist* than I am. All I mean to say is that we have a puzzle on our hands, but not all the pieces... yet."

links.title: You: ""What *is* a crossword?""
links.text: "What *is* a crossword?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Ah, right. Your *condition*. Never..."
links.text: "Ah, right. Your *condition*. Nevermind. All I mean to say is that we have a puzzle on our hands, but not all the pieces... yet."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Anyhow, let's get back to the case..."
links.text: "Anyhow, let's get back to the case. Was there anything else you wanted to know?"

links.title: You: ""Personally, I think labour dispute..."
links.text: "Personally, I think labour disputes are *very* mysterious."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Then you're in luck, because we're..."
links.text: "Then you're in luck, because we're in the midst of a *major* strike by the Dockworkers' Union. Maybe more than that. The Union clearly wants a *piece*, not just of the Industrial Harbour, but the Wild Pines corporation itself..."

links.title: Rhetoric: "Is this a *strike* then -- or the f..."
links.text: Is this a *strike* then -- or the first shots in a *workers' coup*?

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""I expect the case itself to be les..."
links.text: "I expect the case itself to be less challenging than navigating these *community matters*. This district isn't used to the RCM's presence, and the Union rarely overplays its hand -- as it appears to have done in this case..."

links.title: You: ""Wait, so is this a *strike* or an..."
links.text: "Wait, so is this a *strike* or an attempted *coup*?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Strike, coup, revolution, it's bri..."
links.text: "Strike, coup, revolution, it's brigandage however you parse it."

links.title: Rhetoric: "You feel something... rising throug..."
links.text: You feel something... rising through you -- a familiar feeling. AN OPINION taking form...

links.title: You: ""We should ground the workers into..."
links.text: "We should ground the workers into fine paste and feed them to the pigs."

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""When I said we have to navigate co..."
links.text: "When I said we have to navigate community matters, I did not mean we have any *say* in them. I meant we should be careful. If we are not... the *shit* will blow right in our faces." He makes a quick gesture towards his visage -- where the shit would blow.

links.title: Conceptualization: "From an imaginary fan."
links.text: From an imaginary fan.

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Now, was there anything else you w..."
links.text: "Now, was there anything else you wanted to know about the case?"

links.title: You: ""We should ground the *owners* into..."
links.text: "We should ground the *owners* into fine paste and feed them to the pigs."

links.title: You: ""With this little foreknowledge I a..."
links.text: "With this little foreknowledge I am unsure which side to grind into pigsfeed. The decision must ferment in me. Also -- *nationalism*."

links.title: You: ""I don't think grounding one or the..."
links.text: "I don't think grounding one or the other side into pigsfeed will do anyone favours. I am really, really smart."

links.title: You: ""I've spent the last 20 seconds dec..."
links.text: "I've spent the last 20 seconds deciding on which side to *ground into pigfeed* -- why?"

links.title: Kim Kitsuragi: ""Politics is habit-forming. And haz..."
links.text: "Politics is habit-forming. And hazardous. It is also irrelevant to policework. You are right to doubt the impulse, it might be detrimental to our task here."

links.title: Encyclopedia: "You sense that there's more to it t..."
